p.span: The health and safety of ourGriffin tribe is our highest priority and privilege. ACA continues to coordinate with local health officials to inform our community and our efforts to minimize the impact of the COVID-19 virus on our students, families, and staff.

strong.em: Due to orders issued by state and local officials,ACA will be closed until further notice. Please check back frequently for updates.

p.span: The ACAcommunity must work together to fight COVID-19. Head tohttp://tea.texas.gov/staywell for vitally important public health guidance to stop the spread. If we stand apart as a community now, we will be together again soon.
Parents are encouraged to educate themselves on the policies and guidelines below to make the best decisions for their families.
UPDATE: 4th Nine Weeks Grading Policy to begin April 20 (CLICK HERE)
VIRTUAL PARENT UNIVERSITIES: Just in time supports for you at home

li.span: Please (CLICK HERE) for videos of important information that will help you with at-home instruction

a.br: 3-24-2020 Update from the Executive Director of Schools

li.span: 3-18-2020Video update from Executive Director of Schools Craig Sims on ACA's COVID-19 response and transitioning to remote learning
The meal pickup location is 2800 W. Arkansas Ln (Primary Campus). If you ordered meals, they are available for pickup from 11-1 on your order day, either Tuesday or Wednesday.
The link to order meals will go live each Friday afternoon for the following week's meals. Anew link is sent via Remind and posted on ACA's Facebook page each Friday around 2pm.
If you have any questions or need to make changes, please email Jamie DVong at jdvong@acaedu.net.

p.span: Please contact your student's campus between the hours of 9-3 weekdays for information regarding remote learning. Many teachers are using the Remind system to communicate with parents and students. If you are not receiving any Remind notifications, please contact your campus or sstewart@acaedu.net.

li.span: Primary Campus 817.274.2008
Intermediate Campus 817.303.1553
Middle School Campus 817.987.1909

p.span: COUNSELING RESOURCES IN TIMES OF CRISIS

li.span: To contact your School Counselor or request a meeting with your School Counselor:

span.a: CommonSenseMedia Resources for Families during Coronavirus Pandemic

span.span: Statewide Resources for Mental Health or MISC needs; (click here)

p.span: AllACA facilities are cleaned and disinfected daily during operation.ACA uses recommended products as well as electrostatic disinfectant misting applicators to destroy germs on surfaces throughout our buildings.Additionally, staff support the sanitization efforts by using recommended products like Lysol and Clorox disinfectant wipes to sanitize multi-touch items like doorknobs, desks, etc.

br.span: ACA works because of the partnership of our school and the parents of our students. Parents should support staff endeavors to review good hygiene with your family to help keep them safe.Health officials continue to recommendeveryday preventive actions tolessen the spread of viruses. Practices such as:

li.span: Stay home until fever-free for at least 24 hours without using fever-reducing medication. Do not come to school if you feel ill.
Cover your mouth with your upper arm or a tissue when coughing or sneezing and then throw that tissue away.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol if soap and water are not available.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

p.span: Stay informed. Utilize reliable sources like the CDC to empower yourself with knowledge about the virus.CLICK HERE FOR MORE INFORMATION
If your student is considered a vulnerable student due to a documented underlying condition, please contact your campus to determine the best procedure to serve your student.

div.p: ARLINGTON CLASSICS ACADEMY does not discriminate in its admission decisions and no person shall be excluded from participation in, denied the benefits of, or subjected to discrimination, harassment or retaliation in any ARLINGTON CLASSICS ACADEMY program on the basis of age; race, color, or national origin; sex, gender, or gender identity; or disability, or relationship or association with an individual with a disability; or any other basis protected by law in the educational program or activity which it operates. ARLINGTON CLASSICS ACADEMYS Title IX Coordinator can be contacted at 817-987-1819 x 3000.

Arlington Classics Academy offers career and technical education programs in the fields of business and technology. Admission to these programs is based on general admission to the school and class enrollment size. It is the policy of Arlington Classics Academy not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex or handicap in its vocational programs, services, or activities as required by Title VI of the CIvil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Educaiton Amendments of 1972; the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended; and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. Arlington Classics Academy will take steps to assure that lack of English language skills will not be a barrier to admission and participation in alleducaitonal and vocational programs.
